level.introtext: You're almost to the end! Can you output the right answers?
level.endtext: Congratulations! You've mastered data types and variables!
level.code: You can use input() to read in data from the keyboard. input = input() //Let's suppose the user types in hello print(input) Strings can be added together; this is called CONCATENATION part1 = "hello " spart2 = "world" print(part1 + part2)
